title.narrative: Global Procurement Initiative: Procurement Assistance for Brazil: Phase I Workshops & Phase II Study Tour, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: This Global Procurement Initiative: Procurement Assistance Program for Brazil: Phase I Workshops and Phase II Study Tour establishes the Government of Brazil (GoB) as an official GPI partner country and encompasses three separate and distinct activities: 1) a three-day Workshop for national-level government procurement officials in Brasilia, Brazil for 70-90 government procurement officials and up to 20 observers in or around August 2017; 2) a three-day Workshop for state and municipal-level government procurement officials in a city other than Brasilia for 70-90 government procurement officials and up to 20 observers following the national-level workshop; and 3) a Phase II value-based procurement Study Tour in late 2017/early 2018. All activities are carried out in collaboration with the Brazilian Ministry of Planning, Development and Management (MP), the George Washington University Law School's Government Procurement Law Program, and USTDA's GPI technical specialists. USTDA will sign a Memorandum of Understanding with MP at the national-level Workshop in Brasilia to formally establish a partnership under the GPI.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

description.narrative: This grant funds the Solvi Landfill Gas-to-Energy and Solar Cap Feasibility Study for Solvi Valorizacao Energetica in Brazil. This study will evaluate the technical, economic, and financial feasibility of implementing a suite of landfill energy projects at five sites managed by Solvi Valorizacao Energetica, a Brazilian private waste management company.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Solvi Landfill Gas-To-Energy And Solar Cap, through ARCADIS NV

description.narrative: This grant funds the Solvi Landfill Gas-to-Energy and Solar Cap Feasibility Study for Solvi Valorizacao Energetica in Brazil. This study will evaluate the technical, economic, and financial feasibility of implementing a suite of landfill energy projects at five sites managed by Solvi Valorizacao Energetica, a Brazilian private waste management company. Specifically, the study will assess the feasibility of landfill gas-to-energy production with gas engine-generator sets at four designated landfill sites, the development of anaerobic bioreactors at these sites to enhance the methane yield, the development of state-of-the art gas conditioning systems for the landfills, and finally, the feasibility and conceptual design for a solar cap system at a fifth site that would generate renewable solar energy.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - MANAUS WATER EFFICIENCY PROJECT, through Government of Brazil

description.narrative: The objective of the Manaus Water Efficiency Improvement Project feasibility study is to improve efficiency in the water distribution system of the city of Manaus by reducing non-revenue water loss. The total cost for this feasibility study is $808,621, which is cost-shared on a 60-40 basis with Halcrow, Inc. (Denver, CO). USTDA's share of the study is $485,173. The feasibility study grant to Aguas do Amazonas S.A. identifies system deficiencies including leakages, losses due to fraud and energy inefficiencies, and makes recommendations for both short-term system improvements, allowing Aguas do Amazonas to improve and extend water supply services in the city of Manaus.
